cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast across Florida’s Big Bend tonight, then accelerating northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas and emerging off the North Carolina coast toward the mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City, NC to Oregon Inlet, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line, FL to Surf City, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, coastal Georgia, South Carolina, and the Atlantic coast northward through southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts near 50 kt) Friday afternoon through early Saturday; low (4%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–3 ft above ground level possible along the Cape Fear and adjacent barrier islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall 4–8 inches with locally higher values could trigger flash flooding in the Wilmington area Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday into Friday night; hazardous marine conditions and very rough seas.
